channel.title: "java" is not recognized
channel.description:
When I open run its comes 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command
what is wrong? @echo off title Project Insanity java -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar;-server -XX:+AggressiveHeap -XX:MaxHeapFreeRatio=90 -XX:MinHeapFreeRatio=90 -XX:+DisableExplicitGC -XX:+RelaxAccessControlCheck -XX:+UseParallelGC -XX:CompileThreshold=1 -XX:ThreadStackSize=128 server.Server pause

item.title: "java" is not recognized
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

@echo off
title Project Insanity
java -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar;-server -XX:+AggressiveHeap -XX:MaxHeapFreeRatio=90 -XX:MinHeapFreeRatio=90 -XX:+DisableExplicitGC -XX:+RelaxAccessControlCheck -XX:+UseParallelGC -XX:CompileThreshold=1 -XX:ThreadStackSize=128 server.Server
pause

I highlighted the error, if you don’t know where it’s coming from

The issue is that you don’t have environmental variables setup and the batch file is trying to run the command ‘java’ which is a command that does not exist.

Either A) Set up your environmental variables (google it).
Or B) change the word java to the location of your java (example: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_45\bin\java.exe)

Read full topic
